show — shows the values of tags on objects¶

Shows the values of the tags nominated from the objects specified.

FORM

show [flags] <object specifier> <tags>

EXAMPLES

When authenticated as user alice:

$ fish show "Eiffel Tower" rating seen bert/seen
Object with about="Eiffel Tower":
  alice/rating = 7
  alice/seen
  (tag bert/seen not present)

Alternative specifications:

show -a "Eiffel Tower" rating seen /bert/seen
show -i 93bd1999-0998-49cc-8004-af457ce34ce4 rating seen /bert/seen
show -q 'fluiddb/about matches "Eiffel Tower"' rating seen /bert/seen
show -F -a "Eiffel Tower" alice/rating alice/seen bert/seen
show "Eiffel Tower" rating seen /bert/seen
show 93bd1999-0998-49cc-8004-af457ce34ce4 rating seen /bert/seen

All of these commands will show the values the tags alice/rating, alice/seen and bert/seen from the object with about tag “Eiffel Tower” and ID 93bd1999-0998-49cc-8004-af457ce34ce4; The last one may also show other objects since the query

fluiddb/about matches "Eiffel Tower"

is search-engine-style string match that will match any about tag containing the words Eiffel and Tower, ignoring case, other words and punctuation.

NOTES

The -F option specifies “Fluidinfo-style” full paths; when this option is used, all tag names are assumed be absolute, i.e. must start with the username.

The user’s ability to read tags is regulated by the permissions system.

See also:¶

get, tags
